alert.note: Alert for Clark; Clay; Coles; Cumberland; Effingham; Jasper; Moultrie; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 7:29PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coles, southeastern Moultrie, Jasper, southwestern Clark, southeastern Shelby, Cumberland, northeastern Clay and eastern Effingham Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 729 PM CDT, emergency management reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Neoga to near Wheeler to near Ingraham. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mattoon and Jewett around 735 PM CDT. Lerna, Hidalgo and Janesville around 740 PM CDT. Newton and Greenup around 745 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Charleston, Ste. Marie, Hazel Dell, Willow Hill, Casey and Ashmore. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 169 and 193. Interstate 70 between mile markers 101 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Illinois.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Clay; Coles; Cumberland; Effingham; Jasper; Moultrie; Shelby
